feat.name: Arcane Armour
entries: You manifest magic around you, granting you additional protection. While you are not wearing any armour, your base AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier.

feat.name: Corpsman
entries: You master the physician’s arts, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill medicine} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

During a short rest, you can clean and bind the wounds of up to six willing beasts and humanoids. Make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill medicine}) check for each creature. On a success, if a creature spends a Hit Die during this rest, that creature can forgo the roll and instead regain the maximum number of hit points the die can restore. A creature can do so only once per rest, regardless of how many Hit Dice it spends.

feat.name: Counter Strike
entries: You can react to immediate danger with lethal force. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever a creature attacks you, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack towards that creature.

feat.name: Dual Caster
entries: You have mastered the ability to cast multiple spells at once. Whenever you use your action to cast a cantrip that deals damage as an action, you can cast an additional cantrip as a bonus action. The additional cantrip cannot cause damage in this way.

feat.name: Dual Wield Master
entries: You are well practiced with making rapid strikes with a weapon in your off-hand, and gain the following benefits. However, your second off-hand attack can not add special optional attacks like a paladin's smite.

items: If you use two-weapon fighting to use a bonus action to attack with a light weapon, you can attack twice with it instead of once. This can be done with a non-light weapon if used in conjunction with the feat Dual Wielder.
If you throw a light weapon, you can draw another light weapon as part of the action. This can be done with a non-light weapon if used in conjunction with the feat Dual Wielder.

feat.name: Magus
entries: You study the arcane arts, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill arcana} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
You learn the prestidigitation and detect magic spells. You can cast detect magic once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Weapon Artist

prerequisite.other: Proficiency in the weapon type chosen

entries: You have become an artist with your preferred type of weapon. You gain the following benefits:

items: Choose a particular weapon type (i.e. long swords, spear, quarterstaff, short bow, etc). When you attack with your chosen weapon type, your critical range extends by 1, and you score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

feat.name: Zookeeper
entries: You master the techniques needed to train and handle animals. You gain the following benefits.

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill animal handling} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

You can use a bonus action on your turn to command one friendly beast within 60 feet of you that can hear you and that isn’t currently following the command of someone else. You decide now what action the beast will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you issue a general command that lasts for 1 minute, such as to guard a particular area

feat.name: Surface Dweller
entries: You have spent enough time in the sun that you have grown accustomed to it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You lost the Sunlight Sensitivity trait
You gain proficiency with the {@skill perception} skill

Once you take this feat, you learn the light cantrip if you do not already know it. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the spell daylight once per long rest. Wisdom is your spell casting ability modifier for these spells.

feat.name: Improbable Strength
entries: You're unnaturally strong for your size. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain advantage on ability checks to escape from a grapple or the restrained condition

You are considered one size larger for the purposes of grappling, shoving, carry weight, and wielding weapons. If you already have this benefit from a different source, or if you are under the 'enlarge' effect of the enlarge/reduce spell, you deal an extra 1d4 damage once per turn when you with a heavy and/or two-handed weapon.

feat.name: Adapted to Darkness
entries: You have learned to cope with the darkness to the extreme, honing your senses to supernatural levels and gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain Darkvision out to 30 feet. If you already have Darkvision, or gain it later from another source, increase the range of that Darkvision by 30 feet instead.

feat.name: Bully
entries: You’ve mastered the brutal art of kicking your opponent while they’re down and taking advantage of any and every opening you can find, gaining the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on opportunity attacks.
You are granted an opportunity attack when a creature within your reach attempts to stand up from being prone.
When you are granted an opportunity attack against a creature, instead of a melee attack you may choose to perform a shove attempt against that creature, with advantage on your roll.

feat.name: Deadeye
entries: Knives, darts, and javelins are play toys to you, and you make it apparent with how easily and mind-boggling well you use them. You gain the following benefits:

items: The normal range of your thrown weapon attacks is increased by 10, and the maximum range is increased by 30.
You may draw a weapon with the thrown property with a free hand after each attack you make with a weapon.

You may choose to treat a ranged attack you make with a thrown weapon as a ranged weapon attack, applying the benefits of any racial, class, or feat abilities you have which affect your ranged attacks.

Once on each of your turns when you hit with an attack made with a weapon with the thrown property, you may choose to make it a special ricochet attack, bouncing your weapon off the first target to hit another. Select another creature within the weapon’s normal throwing range of the original target of your attack, and if the original attack roll would have also hit that target, deal damage to it equal to the damage dice of the weapon, of its type. You must release the weapon from your hand if the triggering attack was a melee attack.

feat.name: Element-Touched
entries: You’ve become innately attuned to a certain elemental force, perhaps by distant blood, or perhaps due to a supernatural pact or event. Select acid, cold, fire, thunder, lightning, poison, radiant, or necrotic damage, and gain the following benefits based on your choice:

items: You have resistance to the chosen type of damage.
When you score a critical hit with an attack roll, you deal an additional 1d4 damage of the chosen type.

feat.name: Learned Caster

prerequisite.other: The ability to learn spells or elemental disciplines from a list

entries: You’ve toiled more than the average caster to perfect your magics, tapping into previously unknown powers and gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn an additional 2 level 5 or lower spells from one of your class spell lists of levels which you can cast for that class, or gain an additional 2 elemental disciplines for which you meet the requirements for.
When you gain a level, you may choose to replace 1 of your known spells or elemental disciplines for a new one you meet the requirements for in that class.

feat.name: One With the Sea
entries: Swimming and diving are sport to you, having expanded your lung capacity, perfected your stroke technique, and honed your senses to underwater dangers. You gain the following benefits:

items: You may swim at your normal movement speed in any body of water with a current weaker than that of strong rapids.
You may hold your breath twice as long as normal.
You have advantage on all Constitution checks made to hold your breath, or to swim for an extended period of time.
While actively searching, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to notice objects or creatures which are submerged in water.

feat.name: Point Blank Shot
entries: You have adapted to fighting in close quarters, using smaller ranged weapons to angle effectively and fire rapidly. You gain the following benefits when using a ranged weapon without the Heavy property:

items: When attacking a creature within 30 feet of you with a ranged attack, neither being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, nor the target being prone, imposes the normal disadvantage to the attack roll.

When a hostile creature’s movement would provoke an opportunity attack from you by leaving a space within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a ranged attack against that creature with a -5 penalty to the attack roll.

feat.name: Second Skin
entries: You’ve become so accustomed to wearing your armor that it no longer feels like it’s there to you, granting the following benefits:

items: You don and doff armor in half the normal time, or ¼ the time if assisted.
You can don or doff a shield using your free item interaction for the turn, instead of as an action.
While moving at half your normal speed or resting, you do not take any penalties or disadvantages to your ability checks normally imposed by wearing medium or heavy armor.

feat.name: Tactician
entries: You have a mind for battle, using your superior intellect to predict your opponent’s moves before they make them, and prepare yourself for attack, gaining the following benefits:

items: You may use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier when calculating your Armour Class, including while wearing armour but not when using alternate calculations to your Armour Class. Any maximum modifier bonus is still applied to the new ability modifier.

When you are not surprised, before you roll initiative, you may take a -5 penalty to the roll to gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class, as well as to all attack rolls adn saving throws you make, until the end of your first turn in combat.

feat.name: Athlete (Improved)
entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

items: When you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.
You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

Once per long rest, when you make an {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} check, you may choose to roll 1d6 and add it to the result. You must make this choice after seeing the roll, but before you know the results.

feat.name: Charger (Improved)
entries: When you use your action to {@action Dash}, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack or to {@action shove} a creature.

If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before taking this bonus action, you either gain a +5 bonus to the attack's damage roll (if you chose to make a melee attack and hit) or push the target up to 10 feet away from you (if you chose to shove and you succeed).
When you successfully shove a creature, you may also choose to deal 5 bludgeoning damage to it.

feat.name: Dungeon Delver (Improved)
entries: Alert to the hidden traps and secret doors found in many dungeons, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Arcana} checks made to identify particular traps and dungeons.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
Traveling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal -5 penalty on your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score.

feat.name: Healer (Improved)
entries: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a {@item healer's kit|phb} to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains hit points equal to your level.

As an action, you can spend one use of a {@item healer's kit|phb} to tend to a creature and restore {@dice 1d6 + 4} hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master (Improved)
entries: You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are wearing heavy armor, all damage that you take is reduced by 3.

feat.name: Linguist (Improved)
entries: You have studied languages and codes, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn three languages of your choice.

You can ably create written ciphers. Others can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus), or they use magic to decipher it.

Your mastery of language has afforded you a way with words. Once per long rest, when you make a Charisma ability check, you may choose to roll 1d6 and add it to the result. You must make this choice after seeing the roll, but before you know the results.

feat.name: Savage Attacker (Improved)
entries: Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total. Additionally, once per long rest, when you score a critical hit with an attack, you may choose to add a single additional weapon die of damage. You must make this decision after you see the attack roll, but before damage is rolled.

feat.name: Tough (Improved)
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points. Additionally, once per long rest, you may choose to reroll a single death saving throw and use the higher result.

feat.name: Metamagician
entries: You gain a deeper understanding of the functions of metamagic.

items: You gain 1 sorcery point. You can only use this sorcery point on metamagic unless you have other features taht allows you to use sorcery points.
You gain one sorcerer metamagic option.

feat.name: Metamagic Reservoir
entries: Your metamagic pool increases in size. Your maximum  sorcery points increase by 2.

feat.name: Shield Bearer
entries: Sometimes, others can benefit from your skill with a shield more than you could.

items: You can choose to impose disadvantage on any attack of opportunity made against a creature within 5 feet of you.

feat.name: Sniper
entries: Given the time to line up your shot, you inflict grievous wounds.

items: Attack at long range with a ranged weapon does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
At the start of your turn, you can reduce your speed to zero and deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus with your next ranged weapon attack made before the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Bow Mastery
entries: Bows are used by many, but you have trained to make the most of them. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use the Attack action with a short bow on your turn, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.
When you use a longbow, its damage die increases from a d8 to a d10.
You can use Strength instead of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls you make with longbows.

feat.name: Might of the Magus
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on the d20 roll of a saving throw against a spell you cast that deals damage, they take the maximum possible damage from the dice, instead of the result you rolled.

feat.name: Gish's Aftermagic
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that does damage, the next successful weapon attack you make before the end of your turn deals an additional 1d10 damage, the same type as the spell you cast.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dōbutsu come of age in their teens and rarely exceed one century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Being so closely aligned with the fey, dōbutsu take after them and their chaotic natures.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dōbutsu vary from below five feet to seven feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Beast Senses
entries: You are proficient in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: You may choose the type of dōbutsu you will be. There are four types: Neko, Kitsune, Okami or Usagi.

The neko have similarities to domesticated cats. People usually think of them as being weaker than the other dōbutsu. They often go adventuring having a super high chance of leaving home because of the curiosity inside them. The neko have tails and ears that are more glossy and often lick them. The nekos of the past often were seen with wild cats that seemed to be close companions.

entries.name: Naturally Graceful
entries: Cats always land on their feet. You have resistance to fall damage.

entries.name: Elusive
entries: Opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

The kitsune get traits resembling a fox yokai. They are more like tricksters than the other dōbutsu and have a higher chance of becoming chaotic. Kitsune fur has a large amount of magic made into it giving the appearance of glowing. The kitsune often tricks humans into falling in love with it then taking them out.

entries.name: Fox Tails
entries: You have the tail of a fox and gain an additional tail every other level until you have 9 tails. You can use your tail as if it were a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: Fox Illusion
entries: You know the minor illusion cantrip. At 5th level, you can cast the alter self spell once, requiring no material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

The okami are the wolf of the dōbutsu world. They are super loyal and often are more lawful than chaotic. The okami fur is often wilder than the other subraces. In the past, they were the strongest warriors in the dōbutsu. They were as crazy as Norse berserkers but also had a strong scene of morals. They have mostly kept the same moral but some have twist law so that they may accomplish their goals.

entries.name: Keen Ears
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

The Usagi have similarities to rabbits. People usually think of them as being weaker than the other dōbutsu. They often go adventuring having a super high chance of leaving home because of the curiosity inside them. The Usagi have tails and ears that are more glossy and often lick them. The Usagi of the past often were rarely seen unless to give aid to hurt or lost travelers.

entries.name: Nimble Climber
entries: Your limbs are strengthened by your animal aspect. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Rabbit's Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Age
entries: Oni reach maturity about the same time as humans do, but their aging slows down drastically after that. Most live to about 1000 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most oni are naturally evil. Their heightened sensitivity to the temptations of the Material Plane usually drives them to steal, fight and manipulate to get what they want.

entries.name: Size
entries: Oni are a sizeable people, reaching heights from 7 and 8 feet tall by maturity and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: As a creature of the night, you are very good at seeing in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Yokai Resistance
entries: Thanks to the energy of the yokai, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against becoming poisoned.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Supernatural Strength
entries: You can wield a weapon with the versatile property in one hand, but use the damage dice as if you were wielding it in two hands. In addition, Half-Oni's add their proficiency bonus to damage when making an unarmed attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write, Common and Giant.

The most common out of the oni, red oni or aka oni are known for their large size and toughness. They are slightly bigger than the rest of their kin, with skin coloration in shades of dark red. They are violent, hot-headed, and unfocused, often pursuing immediate satisfaction and disregarding long-term plots and schemes.

entries.name: The Revel Continues
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Blue oni or ao oni are known for their unnatural cunning and aptitude for magic. They are smaller than their red kin, though larger than their pale kin, and with skin coloration of shades of dark blue. They are usually calculating and meticulous pursuing lofty goals such as of power and knowledge.

entries.name: Oni Magic.
entries: Blue oni can muster the innate magic within themselves which gets stronger as they grow in power. You know the dancing lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the charm person spell once and need to finish a long rest before you can cast it again. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Pale oni or shiro oni are known for their aloofness and connections to the spiritual realm. They are the smallest of oni, and are the fewest. Their skin can vary from pale white to light grey. Unlike the other oni, pale oni wish only to keep the balance between the Spirit World and the Material Plane. They usually guard locations where the presence of the Spirit World but sometimes adventure to seek artifacts of the spirit world or mend imbalances.

entries.name: Spirit Walk.
entries: You teleport when you take the dash action.

entries.name: Age
entries: After achieving sentience, starforged mature at the same age as humans. They can live until their core run out of energy, a process that can take up to 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most starforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality, but some have absorbed the morality—or lack thereof—of the beings they served with.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most starforged stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Starforged Resilience
entries: Your constructed and cosmic nature grants you the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold damage
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body is composed of metal, stone, and strands of starlight. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Automatas don't age in the same way as other races do, but their body slowly decays if not taken care of properly. Automata can survive only for 5 to 50 years, depending on what it is made of, if it doesn't have access to the proper materials or tools required for its maintenance. After that time, it will crumble, rust or rot away. Proper maintenance can make an Automata immortal.
For the purpose of game mechanics, you're immune to biological aging, both magical and non-magical.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Built as slaves or servants, most Automatas keep their 'rule - encased ' mentality even when free, and tend therefore towards lawful alignments. They don't seem to show a predilection for good or evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: An Automata's size can vary greatly, ranging from as little as 3 feet to more than 8. Your size is either Medium or Small (your choice).

entries.name: Artificial being
entries: Even though you still count as a humanoid, your body doesn't work as the one of any other mortal race. You gain the following additional traits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, the armor incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

entries.name: Not far from humanoids.
entries: Even though you are not made of flesh and bone (at least in most cases), you still need to enter a 'sleeping ' state for 6 hours a day, like a normal person would, though it's more like a temporary shut-down to you. Most Automatas can't dream.','Also, you don't necessarily need to eat, but you do require to consume some kind of energy in order to keep yourself active: it could be sunlight, coal, or even food. The DM will decide whether your choice of power source is eligible or not. In order to keep all your systems functioning you also require air (be it for some kind of chemical/ magical/ photosynthetic reaction that happens inside you or something else) like a normal human would.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Geo-Construct
entries: You are composed of mostly inorganic matter, be it metal, stone or crystals. You gain the following traits:

items: You gain immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dendro-Contruct
entries: You are made of wood and other plant-derived materials, causing your body to work similarly to a plant. You gain the following traits:

items: You do not need to sleep. Instead, you can rest by doing light activity while remaining relative still (like keeping watch or reading a book).
You do not need to eat or drink as long as you have access to sunlight or a good amount of soil.
You can go 1 hour without breathing without suffering ill consequences.
You gain proficiency in the Nature or Survival skills.

entries.name: Geo-Construct
entries: Your body is constructed using organic matter in the necromantic way, and thus share characteristics of an undead. You gain the following traits:

items: You gain resistance to necrotic damage.
You have advantage on checks and saving throws to avoid exhaustion.
You can go 1 hour without breathing without suffering ill consequences.

You have some form of innate magic implanted into your system. You learn one cantrip. Choose the cantrip from the bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip depends on the spell list you chose from: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.
